intro: Tounatea hayesii, commonly known as the Hayes' tounatea, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tounatea hayesii is considered a species of conservation concern.
